data.sampled: It depends on how you measure weight.  A pound is defined as one sixth the mass of an object with known dimensions, for example the distance from earth to sun.  If this object was 90 million miles away and we used it as our standard then one pound would be 6 x 90 million miles which is approximately 540 thousand million miles.  This seems like a lot but in fact there are around 7 trillion grains of sand on all the world's beaches so in reality if you had a bag full of sand each containing one grain of sand that would equal more mass than your cast iron pan.
